text: On tap at Flavor Bistro - Santa Rosa. Pour is light golden with a medium white head. Aroma and flavor of crisp malt, biscuit, sweet corn, and light hops. Easy to drink.
[1/29/16] Draught at Flavor Bistro in Santa Rosa. Golden. Grainy aroma with some DMS. Sweetish flavor, grainy, with DMS, and a bit of crisp bitterness. Rather light-bodied.
Tap at Flavor. Nice grain in the nose, citrus hops, clean. Tangy citrus flavor, rich malt, nicely hopped and well put-together lager.
Draft - Nice grains and honey notes. Clear gold with a small white head. Light grainy bitterness and a long finish. Flavourful and solid.
On tap at flavor pours out a golden topped with a white head. nose is sweet corn some grain and spice. Taste is more of the sweet corn and some spice.
This golden beer has a hippy aroma. Mild in the flavor and pleasingly crisp.

Pours clear light orange, a little darker than the average lager. Aroma is grass, cracked wheat. Taste is bread, more grass, some spice from the hops. Pretty full flavored crisp and refreshing. Problem is a slight diacetyl note in the finish, which others have noticed so I dont think its just this batch, Not bad at all, for the style.
On tap at Redwood Cafe. Pours a pale golden color without much head. Heavy on the hops for a lager, but not overpowering. Bitterness lingers after.
Draft at Flavor. Listed as Lunatic Lager Pils. So not really a Dortmunder. Tevs. Moderate bitterness. A strong grassy character from start to drying finish. Ok but a bit too harsh for me.

On tap in Santa Rosa. Golden appearance with a big white head. Fizzy, grainy, herbal nose with some diacetyl. The flavor is also a bit buttery but not harshly so. Herbal, hay flavor. Wish it had been clean.

This is rather hoppy for a helpless but pretty tasty regardless. It is a hazy orange yellow with a fine bubbled head and a lattice of lacing. It has a mild nose with just a touch of cut hay and citric hops. It seems like it might be a bit sweet but really doesnt come across as such since its quite bitter as well. Some doughy malts come out as the beer warms. This is medium bodied but lightened by crisp carbonation. I would call this an American take on a pilsener. It has a clean yeast character but drinks like an American pale ale.

Keg at Flavor, Santa Rosa, 28/04/14.
Very lightly hazed golden blonde with a good sized off white head that retains well.
Nose is pale malt, light citrics, grass, cereal.
Taste comprises pale malt, light bread notes, cereals, lemon rind, faint hops.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, crisp close.
Decent enough helles.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Burnt yellow. 2 finger creamy head. Almost no nose. Very strange cedar or walnut taste. Almost woody with pine needles and ginger root. Older fruits
Sampler at Jupiter in Berkeley, extremely bready nose and taste, lots of flavor for a lager.
Tap at The Trappist, Oakland. Colour is cloudy golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, citrus, grape, hops and malts.

On tap @ The Trappist. Golden orange pour with a rocky white head. Aroma is bread, dough, and a hint of toast. A bit of grassy hops, some nice floral notes, yeast, and maybe a hint of spice. Nice sweetness to the flavor. Plenty of bread, dough, and toast. Good malt character. Lots of grassy and floral hops. Slightly yeasty and mildly spicy. Solid.

On tap at Flavor in Santa Rosa. Pour is clear golden in appearance with a frothy white head and great lacing. Noble hoppy, grassy, grainy, cereal, straw, and biscuity aroma. Taste is grassy, corny, grainy, husky, crisp and clean with a lightly bitter finish. Light body with high carbonation. Not bad.

Draft @ Jupiter, Berkeley, CA. Pours a hazy yellow golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty grainy aroma. Fruity malty grainy hoppy bitter flavor. Has a fruity malty grainy hoppy bitter finish.

Poured up on tap at Jupiter in Berkeley. It pours with a deep gold body with the slightest of haze and supports a lasting off white head of foam. The mild aroma offers up spicy hops and some floral like hoppiness. The taste is rich and crisp and vibrant with cereal graininess, bitter floral hops, a bit of lemon and lime like citrus hop bitterness and then it picks up a bit more graininess into the finish. It leaves behind a pleasing crisp hop bitterness into the after taste.

Pale straw colour with a tight white head. The aroma is soft and a little bit malty. Soft and a touch minerally but with a light whiff of diacetyl that I could do without. Pretty clean otherwise with a touch of honeyed character. Its okay but Ive had better versions in my time.

On tap. Pours with a clear golden hued body with a large and lasting white head. Aromas are bready, malty, pils with a light floral hop note. Light yeast character and a touch of sulfur. Flavors are Floral, bready, lightly nutty, some hoppiness, honey, floral. Somewhat strong bitterness for the style. Lively bubbles, dry and crisp. Tasty lager.

A - Served a clear golden-orange color with a finger of frothy white head atop. The head fades very slowly leaving behind some nice lacing in the process.

S - Aroma is a very nice balance of light biscuity malts, citrus hops, and some light fruity esters from the yeast.

T - Starts off with some sweet biscuit malt wit ha nice balance of citrus hops and some lager esters in the background. Through the middle, some richer malt with a touch more hops and some light bitterness comes though. The finish is a mix of sweet biscuit malts with a touch of hops, some feint bitterness, and a bit of lager yeast that lingers.

M - Medium-plus bodied with moderate carbonation. Feels smooth with a very crisp and lightly dry finish.

D - Super drinkable. Very well balanced and very refreshing while still being fully flavored and retaining body.

10 ounce sample on tap at Jupiter in Berkeley.  The aroma has some light biscuit and grassiness present. Mild fruitiness, too.  Not to much else here.  Transparent golden body with a small, whitish head, that is pretty weak.  Starts a bit sweet with some corn-like flavors.  Has some biscuit in the middle before this finishes snappy and grassy.  Nice maltiness in this beer.  Its crisp and refreshing.  I still prefer Sudwerks Helles, though.

Draft at Toad in the Hole. Off-clear gold with small head and some lace. Warm malt and bakery aromas with some herb and sulfur undertones. Tastes young and yeasty but with the promise of a very nice bitter-leaning Helles. Needs to crispen up a while.
On tap at Flavor...great clear bright gold... Smells fresh, sweet but a big hop bite... Best tasting lager Ive had and I prefer this to Reality Czech... Get this
Tap. Pours golden, little head. More hops than the standard, but tasty nonetheless.

Draugt at burger. Lucked into a clean line. Very light haze and a nice fluffy white head Ive a golden body. Big hoppy aroma with lots of spice an evergreen, a touch of sulpher and a sweet pils malt graininess. Joppy in te flavor from start to finish. A bit mjnerally and sulphery in a good way. Malt sweetness an bitterness balance very well and bitterness beats malt out in the finish. Medium body with smooth carbonation. Hoppy stuff with a delicious mix of hops. A bit big on body for a German pils but out of this world hoppy to be anything else, so in short, a Moonlight beer, which is just what I wanted.

Draft. A golden beer with a lazing beige head. The aroma has notes of straw. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, straw, sulphur, and grass, leading to a bitter finish, where the straw note lingers.

Fresh herbal and floral hop nose, lots of cotton candy and honey malts, touch of cookie dough and very light peach. Taste is lightly sweet, everything is very well integrated and rounded, lightly bitter, some floral hops, just a touch of butter.
Pours a clear straw yellow with a white head.  Very aromatic - grassy hops and light cream.  Flavor is dry and bitter with tons of grassy hops.  Light buttery popcorn note.
Draft.  A light amber with an inch tall white head leaving decent lacing on the glass.  Smell is of light grassy hops.  Taste is again of grassy hops with a slightly earthy aftertaste.  Light bodied.

I had a couple of pints of this yesterday at some random pizza place alongside the Russian River.  Anyway, this is probably about as good as a lager can get.  Crisp, refreshing and hot damn it goes well with pizza.  If every lager tasted this good our attitudes about them would be different.

Had this at Monks Kettle.

Pours a crystal clear, brilliant golden color with a two-finger lasting foamy white head.  Good lacing.

Aroma is grainy pale malt, a touch of caramel, and floral hops.  Very pronounced for the style and very balanced.

Slightly sweet and bready pilsner malt on the flavor, slight graininess, floral hops, and slight citrus.  Great for a helles lager.  This is what the style should always be.

Clean and crisp on the palate with a good carbonation level and medium-light body.

Overall, an absolutely killer pale lager.  Wish they were all this good.

My Bottom Line:
Lascivious cereal and frothy foam massage this quenching Helless evolving herbal hop bitterness, making you grab a larger sip each time.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A creamy head of foam decorates the misty dark gold. 
-That noble hop finish is really scrumptious.
-The pillowy foam and chewy, smooth body make a beautiful mouthfeel.
-This may have more body than the usual blond lager, but it remains much more drinkable than their Uncle Svensen.  

On tap at Flavor.

Straw yellow with a small head. Aroma is faint, but I can smell bready malty floral. Flavor is lightly bitter at first, and becomes strongly hoppy in the finish. Mouthfeel is astringent but crisp. A good lager.
On tap at Monks Kettle. Pours clear yellow with a nice white head and a floral aroma. There is a clean lager flavor with lots of caramel malt and good balancing hop bitterness.

Clear golden with a fluffy white head. Malty citrus a
and grain aroma and taste with a nice crisp dry semi bitter finish    very drinkable.

On tap at Jupiter. Pours golden yellow with a small white head. Aroma is crisp with pilsner malts and bitter hops,  a touch of cardboard. The flavor is refreshing with nice balance. Cardboardy, but a nice apple touch with a biscuity middle and a strong bitter finish. A memorable pilsner

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2010 Draft @ Flavor. Pours a clear, tarnished golden color; fluffy off-white head with fine-bubbled lacing; nice pour. Very light nose showing a touch of reserved mineral bitterness alongside touches of honey and toastiness. Lively carbonation. Medium mouthfeel: zesty mineral and herbal bitterness coupled to a toasty breadiness, very dry and crisp presence; refreshing, zesty hops and bubbles on the tip of the tongue; hints of green olives. A beautifully sessionable pils. Lengthy finish: toasted malts, light breadiniess, and a long, long, lasting mineral bitterness.
On tap. Clear golden with a dense white head leaving laces. Clean, malty aroma with some hops. Medium body with a solid malt base and a distinct and dominatic aromatic hop finish. 110709

From tap at Flavor. Pours clear and golden yellow with a small white head. Light grassy and bitter aroma. Light sweet malty flavoured with a crisp grassy hoppyness coming through. Bitter and dry crisp finish.

Draft at a restaurant in San Fran.  Its not too clean golden color with some visible carbonation. Aroma is lightly hoppy (lightly herbal), and just clean light malts with a hint of fruity lagerness. The flavor losses the lager fruitiness, which is good. There is beautiful white bread malts with just a bit of herbal hops and a touch of bitterness at the end.  Its just beautifully balanced.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: Pours dark golden with a cream colored head. Nose and flavor are smooth with a touch of grain, caramel and citrus. Dry finish.

On tap at Flavor in Santa Rosa.

It poured a dark yellow color and was smooth  and tasty. good beer
Golden, well made, but lacks anything special.  Much better palate than normal lagers.

On tap at 515 in Santa Cruz. Poured into a big pilsener glass. Clear golden amber color with two fingers of tan head. Nice thick lacing and substantial retention. Aromas of bread and caramel malt with some hop citrus that melds nicely. Flavor is bready with some lactic character. A touch of caramel malt and a nice piney hop finish with moderate bitterness. Kinda of like an overhopped Boston Lager. Great balance, perfect carbonation, semidry finish, excellent drinkability.

Poured from tap a slightly hazy light yellow with small white head.  Aroma was of hay and barnyard. The flavor was much of the same grassy hay with barnyard notes along with a tart bitterness and a small bit of toast.  As for palate, I would call this a palate cleanser because it squeezed most other flavors out of my mouth leaving a puckering tartness.  I think I’ll skip this one next time.

On tap at Flavor, Santa Rosa.  This is a very nice, tasty, hoppy lager.  It is golden with a big, thick white head that lasts for a long time, slowly diminishing to a smaller, foamy head that leaves fairly good lacing.  The aroma is malty grain, bread, somewhat sweet with definite piney hops lingering in the back.  The taste is malty, bready, with some nut and a  pronounced piney hop bitterness soon coming through to balance out the grain sweetness.  It has a crisp finish and a long, nice grain/biscuit/nut aftertaste.  It is refreshing and crisp, but flavourful, with some complexity,  both a good lightly toasted malt and a piney hop bitterness being very prominent.  The balance is nice.

On Tap @ Hamiltons.  Pours with a golden body topped by a medium thick, white head wtih lots of lacing.  Its bitter with a slight sweetness from the malt and a grassy hop note.  Light bodied, crisp and dry.

On tap at Flavor (restaurant in Santa Rosa). Pours deep golden (slightly darker shade of gold than the Reality Czech) - white head. Grain, light noble hop character in the nose. The overall taste has notes of grain, light caramel, grass and a light twinge of lemon. There is a hop presence but as you would expect not as prominent as with their BoPils. Very clean tasting. Medium bodied with a moderate carbonation level. Good lacing and head retention. Overall a very nice drinkin beer.

Tap at Barclays. Pours with a pale golden color and not much of a head. Flavor has some underlying metallic notes, a bit of malts and some grains but not much hops. Aroams are fairly faint, perhaps a bit grainy. Drinkable but nothing to get me excited, I take a decent Pilsener any day.

Draft. Amber color with a whitish head. Spicy aroma with some mineral and malt. More caramel than I would have expected in the flavor to go with some spice and mineral tones. LIngering caramel and mineral. Medium body. Not bad for an easy drinking lager.

(from notes) pint is a hazy gold with a nice white head that laces nicely. aroma is both pleasant and complex - a bunch of different grainy and grassy notes from the malts, mixed with a wonderful herbal hop kick and some nice toasty notes. very nice flavor - interesting but drinkable - with a great interplay between the grains and the hops. finishes dry and not too bitter. great lager - easy to drink, but with a nice degree of complexity.
Draft.  Pours a pale yellow color with a white head  Very faint malt nose.  The flavor is a Nutty and grainy with an oatmeal quality to it.  Very understated.  Slight bitterness in the finish.
Simple, but with nice body and fresh, zesty hop quality that had enough power to get past other beers sampled previously. Fresh from the source at Moonlight.
Nice clean bavarian style lager.  noble hop bitterness very light and earthy. some malt mainly crisp toast and lite nuts. clean finish

Called Moonlight Pilsner @ the Magnolia as a guest tap.  Light yellow.  Grainy regular pils nose, harsh, a little hoppy in the finish, which is well appreciated, though too grainy and moldy tasting overall.

Light gold color. Medium head. Aroma is grainy and a touch fruity. A medium bodied lager. Malts are mild a touch fruity. Hops are spicy and slightly bitter. Nicely balanced. Slightly more flavor than I expected from a lager. Smooth taste. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly bitter with a touch of roasted malts. Not sure if it supposed to be there or not, but it makes it a little more interesting.
Slightly Mexican spice in the nose, high effervescence, very nice bittering spectrum for a very light bodied lager. A bit of crispness is lost in the unbalanced extended tongue. Very nice.
